track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Join HourRank 17, a 60 minute contest where the fastest coder wins!

Top 10 coders win HackerRank T-shirts. Sign up now and we'll notify you before start time so you don't miss out. 
The author of this round is Sunny Aggarwal (ma5termind). The problems are tested by Dan Sagunov.

model.name: Organizing Containers of Balls
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin","r");
fscanf($handle,"%d",$q);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $q; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle,"%d",$n);
    $M = array();
    for($M_i = 0; $M_i < $n; $M_i++) {
    	$M_temp = fgets($handle);
    	$M[] = explode(" ",$M_temp);
      array_walk($M[$M_i],'intval');
    }
    // your code goes here
}

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

q = gets.strip.to_i
for a0 in (0..q-1)
    n = gets.strip.to_i
    M = Array.new(n)
    for M_i in (0..n-1)
        M_t = gets.strip
        M[M_i] = M_t.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
    end
    # your code goes here
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n = read n_temp :: Int
        m_temp <- getMultipleLines n
        let m = map ( map ( read :: String -> Int ) . words ) m_temp
        -- your code goes here


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Determine if David can perform some sequence of swap operations such that each container holds one distinct type of ball.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          q_t (read-line) 
          q (Integer/parseInt q_t) 
        ]

      (
        loop [a0 q]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              n_t (read-line) 
              n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
            ]
          )

          (
            let [
              M (for [M_temp (range n)]  (map #(Integer/parseInt %) (split (read-line) #"\s+") )  )
            ]
          )

        ; your code goes here
        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
            M = read_2darray(N,N,"~d"),
            % your code goes here
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < q do
    n = io.read("*number", "*l")
    M = {}
    for M_i = 1,n do
    	M_temp = io.read()
    	M_j = 1
    	M[M_i] = {}
    	for token in string.gmatch(M_temp, "[^%s]+") do
    		M[M_i][M_j] = token
    		M_j = M_j + 1
    	end
    end
    -- your code goes here
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
